intro: Bumelia texana, commonly known as Texas bumelia, is a shrub native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes plants known for their milky sap. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is found in areas such as Texas and Oklahoma. It has small, green leaves and produces yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, aiding in its propagation.
